page.title: 17TRAFFIC
page.content:
The{A63T}- the main Hull-Leeds road - bisects the village of Thorpe Willoughby. There is much traffic, especially H.G.V.'s. The amount of traffic and the speed at which the vehicles travel pose many problems for residents. There is an accident 'black spot' where a minor road joins the A63. Residents also feel that lighting is poor on the main road which adds to the problem. Delays also occur at the level crossings in Thorpe Willoughby.
A proposed{by-pass}for Selby could alleviate some problems on the A63. One of the routes, which starts close to Thorpe Gates and goes to the South of Selby, would reduce traffice from the estimated figure of 6900 vehicles per day in l991 to 4600 vehicles.
